Summary: Stationary very bright star flashes; becomes huge star, then becomes a small object moving west across sky.
trends: There have been 579 other sightings in New York
There was one other sighting in New York on or around May 24th 2008
divs: Sighting DetailsMy girlfriend and I were returning home from a family gathering when I noticed a bright star in the south west sky just west of Manhattan in NYC. Our perspective of this event was from Knolls Crescent in the Spuyten Duyvil section of the Bronx in NYC. I pointed the star out to my girlfriend stating "wow look how bright that star is" she agreed. I then told my girlfriend that the object was "too bright to be just a star" and that it was "probably a planet". Suddenly, the object flashed and grew to an enormous white light (aproximately 10X its original size), then the light just vanished and we both saw a small object moving from the sight where the light had been due west before vanishing into the night sky.
